role_in_ecosystem: Third-party organization processing payment transactions on behalf of merchants and acquirers; Routes transactions between merchants, acquirers, and card networks
official_definition: Service provider that processes over 1 million payment transactions per month aggregated across all clients; Must maintain PCI DSS Level 1 compliance; Routes authorization requests and responses; Manages settlement; Provides payment infrastructure
primary_responsibilities: Transaction processing and routing; Authorization request handling; Settlement management; Gateway services; Fraud detection and prevention; Transaction reporting; PCI DSS Level 1 compliance maintenance; Security infrastructure management; Network connectivity; API provision; Tokenization services; Multi-currency processing
secondary_responsibilities: 24/7 system monitoring; Disaster recovery; High availability infrastructure; Load balancing; Network redundancy; Security monitoring; Compliance reporting; Merchant/acquirer support; Integration support; Documentation; Technical training; Performance optimization; Innovation and updates
pci_dss_requirements: Must maintain PCI DSS Level 1 compliance; Submit annual Report on Compliance (RoC) by QSA; Pass quarterly vulnerability scans by ASV; Implement all 12 PCI requirements; Maintain secure processing infrastructure; Conduct annual penetration testing; Maintain security policies; Report security incidents within 24-72 hours; Provide compliance evidence to clients
relationship_to_merchants: Provides processing infrastructure; May provide hosted payment pages; Offers tokenization to reduce merchant scope; Provides compliance tools and reporting; May offer PCI compliance assistance; Routes merchant transactions securely; Provides technical integration support; Offers merchant portals; Provides transaction reporting; Maintains transaction security
relationship_to_processors: Provides processing on behalf of acquirers; Routes transactions to card networks; Manages technical connectivity; Provides settlement services; May white-label services; Supports processor's merchant portfolio; Provides compliance reporting; Coordinates security requirements; Handles technical issues; Provides infrastructure redundancy
relationship_to_acquirers: Processes transactions for acquirer's merchants; Provides technical infrastructure; Manages network connectivity; Supports acquirer compliance programs; Provides transaction data and reporting; Coordinates security incidents; Provides compliance documentation; Handles settlement processing; Supports risk management; Provides technical support
typical_service_scope: Full-service payment processing; Authorization and settlement; Multi-currency; Global card network connectivity; Tokenization; Fraud tools; Reporting and analytics; API integration; Gateway services; POS and e-commerce support; 24/7 processing; High-volume capability
geographic_scope: Global or multi-regional; Data centers in multiple locations; Network connectivity worldwide; Multi-currency support; Operates in 50-200+ countries; Supports global merchants; Multiple time zones; Disaster recovery across regions
regulatory_authority: PCI Security Standards Council (Level 1 requirements); Card network operating rules; Regional financial regulations; Data protection laws (GDPR, CCPA, etc.); Payment system regulations by country; Industry-specific regulations; Local data residency requirements
compliance_enforcement: Subject to annual QSA assessment; Must pass quarterly ASV scans; Can be suspended by card networks; Subject to fines for breaches; Must remediate findings; Can be delisted by networks; Subject to compliance monitoring; Must maintain certifications continuously
data_requirements: Transaction data; Cardholder data (encrypted); Merchant data; Settlement data; Authorization data; Network routing data; Fraud data; Security logs; Configuration data; Compliance documentation; Incident reports; Performance metrics; System access logs
communication_protocols: Secure APIs; Encrypted communications; SFTP for file transfers; Webhook notifications; Dashboard portals; Email alerts; Phone support (24/7); Technical documentation; Service status pages; Security advisories; Incident notifications; Compliance reporting portals
incident_response_role: Critical role in breach investigation; Provides forensic data; Coordinates with card networks; Notifies affected parties; Implements containment; Provides transaction logs; Supports forensic investigation; Coordinates with QSA/law enforcement; Provides breach reports; Implements remediation; Notifies merchants and acquirers; Maintains incident documentation
annual_assessment_requirements: Annual Report on Compliance (RoC) by QSA; Quarterly ASV vulnerability scans; Annual penetration testing; Internal security assessments; Network segmentation validation; Secure code reviews; Security policy reviews; Risk assessments; Disaster recovery testing; Business continuity testing
certification_requirements: PCI DSS Level 1 Compliance (Annual RoC required); PCI P2PE certification (if applicable); PA-DSS certification (if providing applications); Card network certifications (Visa, MC, AMEX, Discover, JCB); ISO 27001 certification (common); SOC 2 Type II report; Regional payment certifications; Data protection certifications; Financial institution partnerships
professional_standards: PCI Security Standards; ISO 27001; SOC 2; NIST Cybersecurity Framework; Payment network operating rules; Professional payment associations; Industry best practices; OWASP security standards; Cloud security standards (if applicable); Regional payment standards
liability_coverage: Cyber liability insurance ($5M-$100M+); Errors & Omissions insurance; Professional liability insurance; Crime insurance; Technology E&O; Regulatory insurance; Breach response insurance; Business interruption insurance; Typically $10M minimum, often $50M+
examples_global: Worldpay; Fiserv; TSYS; Global Payments; Worldline; Adyen; Stripe; Square; FIS; ACI Worldwide; Verifone; Ingenico; Paysafe; First Data (now Fiserv); Elavon; Checkout.com
key_selection_criteria: PCI DSS Level 1 compliance; Uptime/availability (99.9%+); Transaction processing speed; Global reach; Integration options; Pricing model; Security features; Tokenization capabilities; Fraud prevention; Technical support; Network redundancy; API quality; Compliance support; Reputation; Financial stability

role_in_ecosystem: Hosted payment page or payment form provider that accepts cardholder data on behalf of merchants; May provide tokenization and scope reduction
official_definition: Service provider hosting payment forms and accepting cardholder data; Provides secure checkout pages; May offer tokenization to reduce merchant PCI scope; Routes transactions to processor; May be P2PE validated
primary_responsibilities: Hosted payment page provision; Cardholder data collection; Form hosting and security; Transaction encryption; Tokenization services; PCI scope reduction; Payment form customization; Multi-payment method support; Fraud screening; 3D Secure authentication; Transaction routing; Checkout optimization
secondary_responsibilities: Responsive design forms; Mobile optimization; Multiple language support; Branding customization; Recurring billing support; Subscription management; Split payment support; Multi-currency support; Compliance tools; Analytics and reporting; A/B testing; Conversion optimization; Developer APIs; Integration libraries
pci_dss_requirements: PCI DSS Level 1 compliance OR P2PE validation (may reduce scope); If in-scope: Annual RoC and quarterly scans; If P2PE: Annual P2PE assessment; Must protect cardholder data in transit and at rest; Implement strong encryption; Secure form hosting; Security monitoring; Vulnerability management; Incident response capability
relationship_to_merchants: Provides hosted checkout; Reduces merchant PCI scope significantly; Merchant never touches raw card data; Provides tokens to merchant; Offers compliance tools; Provides integration code; Offers checkout customization; Provides fraud tools; Offers reporting dashboard; Technical integration support; Developer documentation
relationship_to_processors: Routes tokenized transactions to payment processors; Integrates with multiple processors; Provides processor-agnostic solution; Coordinates with processor APIs; Passes authorization requests; Handles processor responses; Provides processor failover; Supports multiple processor relationships
relationship_to_acquirers: May work directly with acquirers or through processors; Provides gateway services for acquirer's merchants; White-label gateway solutions; Coordinates compliance; Provides technical integration; Supports acquirer risk management; Provides transaction routing; Manages acquirer relationships
typical_service_scope: Hosted payment pages; Checkout form hosting; Tokenization; Multi-payment methods (cards, wallets, ACH); E-commerce focus; Card-not-present transactions; Recurring billing; Subscription management; Mobile checkout; International payments; Fraud screening; 3D Secure
geographic_scope: Global reach; Cloud-hosted infrastructure; Multi-region data centers; CDN for performance; Supports 100-150+ countries; Multi-currency; Multiple payment methods; High availability; Disaster recovery; Low latency worldwide
regulatory_authority: PCI Security Standards Council; Regional data protection laws; E-commerce regulations; Consumer protection laws; Financial services regulations (varies by country); Payment system oversight; P2PE validation requirements (if applicable)
compliance_enforcement: If PCI in-scope: Annual QSA assessment required; Quarterly ASV scans; If P2PE validated: Annual P2PE assessment; Subject to card network oversight; Can be suspended for non-compliance; Must remediate findings; Continuous compliance monitoring required
data_requirements: Cardholder data (temporarily); Transaction data; Tokenization mapping (secure); Merchant configuration; Fraud data; 3D Secure authentication data; Customer payment preferences; Checkout analytics; Security logs; Encryption keys (secure HSM storage); Compliance evidence
communication_protocols: RESTful APIs; JavaScript libraries; SDKs (multiple languages); Webhook notifications; Dashboard UI; Email notifications; Developer documentation; Sandbox environments; API keys; OAuth authentication; Secure file transfers; Status pages; Support ticketing systems
incident_response_role: Investigates payment data breaches; Notifies affected merchants; Provides forensic logs; Coordinates with processors/acquirers; Implements security patches; Conducts post-incident review; Notifies card networks; Supports law enforcement; Documents incident; Implements remediation; Communicates with customers
annual_assessment_requirements: Annual PCI DSS compliance (RoC or P2PE assessment); Quarterly vulnerability scans; Annual penetration testing; Code security reviews; Encryption validation; P2PE re-assessment (if applicable); Internal security audits; Risk assessments; Disaster recovery testing; Compliance documentation reviews
certification_requirements: PCI DSS Level 1 Compliance OR PCI P2PE Validation; Payment network certifications; 3D Secure certifications; Regional e-commerce certifications; ISO 27001 (recommended); SOC 2 Type II; Payment method certifications (Visa, MC, AMEX); Data protection certifications (GDPR); Cloud security certifications
professional_standards: PCI DSS; P2PE standards; ISO 27001; SOC 2; OWASP Top 10; Cloud security standards; E-commerce best practices; Web application security; Encryption standards; Authentication standards; API security best practices; DevSecOps practices
liability_coverage: Cyber liability insurance ($5M-$50M); Professional liability; Technology E&O; Data breach insurance; Business interruption; Regulatory defense; Typically $5M-$25M for mid-size gateways
examples_global: Authorize.Net; PayPal Checkout; Stripe Checkout; Square Online Checkout; Braintree; Adyen Web; 2Checkout (Verifone); Checkout.com; Worldpay Gateway; BlueSnap; Recurly; Chargebee; PayU; Mollie; Razorpay
key_selection_criteria: PCI compliance/P2PE validation; Uptime (99.95%+); Checkout conversion rates; Global coverage; Payment method support; Integration ease; Developer experience; Pricing/fees; Security features; Fraud prevention; 3D Secure support; Mobile optimization; Customization options; Support quality; Reputation

role_in_ecosystem: Modern cloud-based payment platform providing end-to-end payment infrastructure including processing, gateway, fraud prevention, and compliance tools
official_definition: Comprehensive cloud payment platform providing processing, gateway, fraud prevention, billing, and developer tools; API-first approach; Often combines processor and gateway functions; Modern technology stack
primary_responsibilities: End-to-end payment infrastructure; Payment processing; Gateway services; Fraud and risk management; Subscription and billing; Multi-payment method orchestration; Developer APIs and SDKs; Compliance automation; Revenue optimization; Analytics and reporting; Global payment support; Marketplace/platform payments
secondary_responsibilities: Payment method optimization; Revenue recovery; Dunning management; Smart routing; Payment method localization; Tax calculation; Invoice generation; Customer portal; Reconciliation tools; Reporting and insights; Webhook management; Multi-entity support; Compliance documentation; Integration marketplace; Developer community
pci_dss_requirements: Must maintain PCI DSS Level 1 compliance; Annual Report on Compliance (RoC); Quarterly vulnerability scanning; Comprehensive security controls; Encryption and tokenization; Network security; Access controls; Security monitoring; Incident response; Regular security testing; Compliance reporting to clients
relationship_to_merchants: Provides complete payment infrastructure; Reduces merchant complexity; Handles PCI compliance burden; Provides developer-friendly APIs; Offers compliance tools and documentation; Simplifies integration; Provides fraud tools; Handles multiple payment methods; Provides revenue optimization; Offers detailed analytics; Self-service dashboard; Extensive documentation
relationship_to_processors: May partner with local processors for global reach; Combines processor and gateway functions; Direct card network connections; May use processor partners in certain regions; Provides processor switching/routing; Handles processor relationships on merchant's behalf
relationship_to_acquirers: May work with acquirers or bypass them; Direct acquiring in some markets; Partner with acquirers for specific regions; White-label solutions for acquirers; Provide acquiring infrastructure; Support acquirer merchant portfolios
typical_service_scope: Full-stack payment platform; Processing and gateway; Fraud prevention; Billing and subscriptions; Payment orchestration; Multi-currency and multi-method; Developer tools and APIs; Compliance automation; Revenue optimization; Analytics; Global coverage; Modern technology stack
geographic_scope: Global cloud infrastructure; Multi-region presence; 40-100+ countries supported; Cloud-native architecture; High availability; Auto-scaling; CDN integration; Edge computing; Worldwide payment method support; Local payment methods; Cross-border optimization
regulatory_authority: PCI SSC Level 1; Card network regulations; Cloud security regulations; Data protection laws (GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, etc.); Financial services regulations; E-money licenses (Europe); Payment institution licenses; Country-specific payment regulations; API security standards
compliance_enforcement: Annual QSA assessment required; Quarterly ASV vulnerability scans; Subject to card network oversight; Continuous compliance monitoring; Must maintain certifications; Can face network fines; Must report incidents; Regular penetration testing; Security audits; Compliance reporting to merchants
data_requirements: Transaction data; Cardholder data (tokenized); Customer data; Payment method data; Subscription data; Fraud signals; Analytics data; Billing data; Tax data; Reconciliation data; API usage data; Webhook data; Security and audit logs; Compliance evidence
communication_protocols: RESTful APIs; GraphQL (some platforms); SDKs (10-20+ languages); Webhooks; Dashboard UI; Mobile SDKs; CLI tools; API documentation (interactive); Sandbox environments; Developer portal; Community forums; Email/phone support; Status page; Chat support; Integration guides
incident_response_role: Leads breach investigation; Rapid incident response; Forensic analysis; Customer notification; Network coordination; Security containment; Remediation implementation; Post-incident analysis; Regulatory notification; Law enforcement cooperation; Communication management; Continuous monitoring; Preventive measures
annual_assessment_requirements: Annual PCI DSS Level 1 RoC; Quarterly ASV scans; Annual penetration testing; Cloud security assessments; API security testing; Application security reviews; Infrastructure security audits; Compliance framework assessments; SOC 2 audits; ISO certifications; Regional compliance audits

role_in_ecosystem: Provider of point-of-sale hardware, software, and services for in-person payment acceptance; May provide P2PE solutions
official_definition: Service provider offering POS terminals, software, and services for card-present transactions; Manages hardware and software; May provide P2PE to reduce merchant PCI scope; Handles in-person payment acceptance
primary_responsibilities: POS hardware provision; POS software licensing; Payment terminal management; In-person transaction processing; EMV chip card acceptance; Contactless payment support (NFC); PIN entry device (PED) security; Terminal configuration; Merchant training; Technical support; Hardware maintenance; Software updates
secondary_responsibilities: Inventory management; Employee management; Customer relationship management (CRM); Reporting and analytics; Multi-location support; Offline mode; Receipt printing; Barcode scanning; Kitchen display systems (restaurants); Table management; Appointment scheduling; Loyalty programs; Gift card management; E-commerce integration
pci_dss_requirements: If in-scope: PCI DSS compliance required; PCI PTS (PIN Transaction Security) certification for terminals; P2PE validation (if applicable - reduces merchant scope significantly); Secure terminal configuration; Encryption of card data; Secure key management; Physical terminal security; Software security updates; Vulnerability management; Incident response
relationship_to_merchants: Provides POS hardware and software; May offer P2PE to reduce merchant scope; Handles terminal deployment; Provides training; Offers technical support; Manages software updates; Provides payment acceptance; May integrate with payment processor; Offers merchant portal; Provides transaction reports; Compliance guidance
relationship_to_processors: Integrates with payment processors; Routes transactions through processor; Coordinates terminal certifications; Provides processor-specific configurations; Supports processor security requirements; May partner with specific processors; Handles processor API integration; Coordinates terminal updates
relationship_to_acquirers: Works with acquirers for merchant deployment; Coordinates merchant onboarding; Provides terminal programming; Supports acquirer merchant portfolio; May be recommended by acquirer; Coordinates compliance programs; Handles terminal logistics; Provides integration support
typical_service_scope: POS hardware (terminals, tablets, mobile readers); POS software; In-person payment acceptance; EMV chip and contactless; PIN debit; Signature capture; Receipt printing; Inventory management; Employee management; Multi-location; Reporting; Industry-specific features (retail, restaurant, services)
geographic_scope: Varies by provider: Global, national, or regional; Hardware available in 20-100+ countries; Software localization; Multi-language support; Regional payment method support; Local currency; Regional regulatory compliance; Country-specific features
regulatory_authority: PCI PTS requirements; P2PE validation (if applicable); EMVCo certifications; Payment network approval; Regional payment regulations; PCI DSS (if hosting cardholder data); Consumer protection laws; Accessibility regulations; Data protection laws
compliance_enforcement: If in-scope: Subject to PCI DSS assessment; PTS certification required for terminals; If P2PE: Annual P2PE assessment; EMV certification required; Network approval required; Can be decertified; Must update for security patches; Compliance monitoring
data_requirements: If not P2PE: Cardholder data (encrypted); Transaction data; Terminal configuration; Encryption keys (in HSM); PIN data (encrypted); Merchant data; Inventory data; Employee data; Customer data; Analytics data; Receipt data; Security logs; If P2PE: Minimal cardholder data (outside scope)
communication_protocols: Cloud-based dashboards; Mobile apps; Email and SMS; API integrations; Secure terminal communications; Hardware connectivity (WiFi, cellular, Ethernet); Webhook notifications; HTTPS APIs; Encrypted communications; Support channels (phone, email, chat); Knowledge base; Video tutorials
incident_response_role: If breach: Coordinates terminal security investigation; Provides transaction logs; Notifies affected merchants; Implements security patches; Coordinates with processor/acquirer; May replace terminals; Supports forensic investigation; Implements remediation; Reports to networks; Communicates with merchants
annual_assessment_requirements: If PCI in-scope: Annual compliance assessment; PTS certification for new terminals; P2PE annual validation (if applicable); Quarterly vulnerability scans (if applicable); EMV recertification as needed; Security update testing; Internal security reviews; Network approval renewals
certification_requirements: PCI PTS certification (for terminals); P2PE validation (if offering P2PE); EMVCo L1 and L2 certifications; Payment network approvals (Visa, MC, AMEX, Discover); Regional payment certifications; Bluetooth/NFC certifications; ISO 27001 (recommended); SOC 2 (if cloud-based); Accessibility certifications
professional_standards: PCI PTS standards; P2PE standards; EMVCo specifications; PCI DSS (if applicable); Payment network rules; Industry-specific standards; Hardware security standards; Cryptographic standards; Physical security standards; Manufacturing standards; Quality standards
liability_coverage: Product liability insurance; E&O insurance; Cyber liability (if handling data); General liability; Hardware warranty coverage; Typically $2M-$25M depending on size and services offered
examples_global: Square (Terminal, Register, Stand); Clover (Fiserv); Verifone (V400m, P400); Ingenico (Desk/3500, Move/5000); PAX (A920, S920); Toast (restaurant POS); Lightspeed (retail POS); Shopify POS; SumUp; iZettle (PayPal); Zettle; Tyro (Australia)
key_selection_criteria: P2PE validation (for scope reduction); Terminal security (PTS certified); EMV and contactless support; Ease of use; Pricing model; Software features; Integration capabilities; Industry specialization; Hardware quality; Support quality; Update frequency; Offline capability; Multi-location support; Reporting; Scalability

organization_type: Merchant Service Provider / ISO (Independent Sales Organization)
role_in_ecosystem: Independent sales organization or merchant service provider acting as intermediary between merchants and acquirers/processors; Sales and support focus
official_definition: Third-party organization registered with card networks to sell merchant services; Acts as intermediary between merchants and acquiring banks/processors; Focuses on merchant acquisition, support, and relationship management
primary_responsibilities: Merchant prospecting and sales; Merchant onboarding; Application processing; Merchant support and service; Relationship management; Pricing negotiation; Equipment provision; Training and education; Problem resolution; Portfolio management; Compliance support; Transaction monitoring
secondary_responsibilities: Merchant retention; Upselling and cross-selling; Risk monitoring; Chargeback management support; Statement reconciliation; Industry expertise; Local market presence; Referral partnerships; Value-added services; Marketing to merchants; Trade show presence; Community engagement
pci_dss_requirements: May not directly handle cardholder data (out of PCI scope); If handling data: PCI DSS compliance required; Must ensure merchant compliance; Educate merchants on PCI requirements; Collect merchant compliance documentation; Report merchant compliance to sponsor bank; May provide compliance tools; Support merchant assessments
relationship_to_merchants: Direct merchant relationship; Sales and support; Onboarding facilitation; Compliance education; Problem resolution; Statement explanation; Equipment training; Merchant advocacy; Relationship management; Local presence; Responsive support; Personalized service
relationship_to_processors: Works under processor or acquirer; Registers with sponsor bank; Uses processor infrastructure; No direct processing capability; Sales channel for processor; Provides merchant support on processor's behalf; Escalates technical issues to processor; Markets processor services
relationship_to_acquirers: Registered with acquiring bank as ISO/MSP; Acts as sales agent for acquirer; Brings merchants to acquirer; Supported by acquirer infrastructure; Represents acquirer brand (or independent); Paid residuals by acquirer; Subject to acquirer oversight; Monitors portfolio for acquirer
typical_service_scope: Merchant sales and acquisition; Application submission; Merchant support; Equipment sales/leasing; Training and education; Relationship management; Portfolio monitoring; Compliance support; Basic troubleshooting; Merchant advocacy; Payment consulting
geographic_scope: Local, regional, or national; Physical presence in target markets; Relationship-based sales; Face-to-face merchant meetings; Trade show presence; Local advertising; Community involvement; May specialize geographically or by industry
regulatory_authority: Registered with card networks as ISO/MSP; Subject to sponsor bank oversight; Must comply with network operating rules; Subject to ISO/MSP agreements; Background checks required; Financial requirements; Compliance with sales practices; Truth in advertising; Contract transparency
compliance_enforcement: Sponsor bank monitors ISO; Can terminate ISO registration; Subject to fines for violations; Network can deregister ISO; Must comply with sales and marketing rules; Subject to audit by sponsor; Must maintain financial minimums; Reporting to sponsor required
data_requirements: Merchant application data; Sales and commission data; Merchant contact information; Portfolio performance data; May not handle cardholder data; Compliance documentation from merchants; Support ticket data; Training records; Referral data
communication_protocols: Email and phone; CRM systems; Application portals; Merchant onboarding platforms; Face-to-face meetings; Text messaging; Video calls; Training sessions; Webinars; Printed materials; Trade show booths; Social media; Websites
incident_response_role: Facilitates communication during incidents; Notifies sponsor bank/processor; Supports merchant through breach; Connects merchant with resources; Provides local support; Escalates to processor; Assists with forensics coordination; Communicates with affected merchants; Supports remediation efforts
annual_assessment_requirements: ISO/MSP registration renewal; Background checks; Financial reviews by sponsor bank; Portfolio performance reviews; Compliance audits by sponsor; Network monitoring; Sales practice audits; Contract reviews; Training requirements
certification_requirements: ISO/MSP registration with card networks; Sponsor bank approval; Background checks passed; Financial minimums met; Surety bond or reserve requirement; Errors & Omissions insurance; Business licenses; Compliance training completion; Network-specific registrations
professional_standards: ISO/MSP operating rules; Network sales and marketing guidelines; Sponsor bank requirements; Truth in advertising laws; Contract transparency; Sales ethics; Professional conduct; Merchant advocacy; Regional business standards; Payment industry best practices
liability_coverage: Errors & Omissions insurance ($500K-$5M); General liability; Surety bond or reserve (as required by sponsor); Professional liability; Typically $1M-$5M coverage; May require fidelity bond
examples_global: Independent ISOs; Regional MSPs; Payment consultants; Merchant sales agents; Equipment lessors; POS resellers; Agent banks; Payment facilitators (when acting as intermediary); Industry-specific ISOs; High-risk ISOs; Note: Examples are business models rather than specific companies due to thousands of ISOs
key_selection_criteria: Sponsor bank strength; Pricing competitiveness; Commission structure; Support from sponsor; Portfolio ownership; Contract terms; Industry reputation; Training and resources; Technology platforms; Processing partners; Residual terms; Merchant retention; Local presence; Industry specialization; Network relationships
